MEG Expands Christina Lake, Taps Debt Market in Oil-Sands Rebound
MEG Energy ups spending plans for 2017, outlines debt refinancing
item.description: [Reuters] - Canadian oil sands producer MEG Energy's 2017 capital budget will be nearly four times higher than last year's spending, the company said in a statement on Wednesday that also outlined plans to refinance its debt. Calgary-based MEG plans to spend C$590 million ($447.85 million) this year, up from C$125 million in 2016 when the company deferred some production growth projects because of low crude oil prices. A number of Canadian oil and gas producers have laid out plans to spend more in 2017 as global crude prices stabilise above $50 a barrel.
